snippet.textDisplay: A game about a magical puppy who's the son of the sun goddess fighting demons to save the world. Only in Japan, folks.
snippet.textOriginal: A game about a magical puppy who's the son of the sun goddess fighting demons to save the world. Only in Japan, folks.

snippet.textDisplay: For some reason, I played this before Okami. Still haven't completely beaten it, but I really liked it. Chibiterasu is an awesome protagonist, IMO. I actually think I might have experienced nostalgia from this track. Huh.

snippet.textDisplay: The original Okami (PS2, Wii) is a Zelda-style adventure game based on Japanese mythology, with a spell-casting system where you draw brush strokes on the screen.  I haven't played Okami-Den, but that's the Nintendo DS Sequel.  Both games feature traditional Japanese style music like this track.
snippet.textOriginal: The original Okami (PS2, Wii) is a Zelda-style adventure game based on Japanese mythology, with a spell-casting system where you draw brush strokes on the screen.  I haven't played Okami-Den, but that's the Nintendo DS Sequel.  Both games feature traditional Japanese style music like this track.

snippet.textDisplay: Xzaithyr Grymhart Okamiden is a DS adventure game in a similar vein to the Legend of Zelda series; it’s the sequel to the PS2 title Okami, and both have the principle of “What if all the ancient Japanese myths were true, and happened around the same time?” The land of Nippon (which is Japanese for Japan) is based on that. It’s worth a shot if you like Legend of Zelda.
snippet.textOriginal: Xzaithyr Grymhart Okamiden is a DS adventure game in a similar vein to the Legend of Zelda series; it’s the sequel to the PS2 title Okami, and both have the principle of “What if all the ancient Japanese myths were true, and happened around the same time?” The land of Nippon (which is Japanese for Japan) is based on that. It’s worth a shot if you like Legend of Zelda.

snippet.textDisplay:
Much as I loved Okami... I really didn't like Okamiden.  At all.  The music was top notch, sure, but... the gameplay?  Lost all the charm from the original.

Sure, it was more difficult, but having to use the brush and wait for ten seconds for your fat ally to go anywhere, ALL THE TIME, got annoying in a hurry.
snippet.textOriginal:
Much as I loved Okami... I really didn't like Okamiden.  At all.  The music was top notch, sure, but... the gameplay?  Lost all the charm from the original.

Sure, it was more difficult, but having to use the brush and wait for ten seconds for your fat ally to go anywhere, ALL THE TIME, got annoying in a hurry.

snippet.textDisplay: I just beat this game a couple days ago.  Worth every fucking penny.  I had doubts Capcom would be able to live up to Clover Studios' predecessor, but I was wrong (it helps that they at least brought back the same composer).  Definitely an epic way to end the DS era, as it's one of the best DS games I've ever played.
snippet.textOriginal: I just beat this game a couple days ago.  Worth every fucking penny.  I had doubts Capcom would be able to live up to Clover Studios' predecessor, but I was wrong (it helps that they at least brought back the same composer).  Definitely an epic way to end the DS era, as it's one of the best DS games I've ever played.

snippet.textDisplay: Okami did not fail because of piraters.  It was pirated no more or less than any other PS2 games, and plenty of those were popular.  We're all aware that not everyone who pirates would have bought the game, yes?  Even if all the piraters did buy the game, it may still have been commercially unsuccessful.  I keep hearing people blame piracy for this games failure, but if you're gonna do it, back it up with some numbers.
snippet.textOriginal: Okami did not fail because of piraters.  It was pirated no more or less than any other PS2 games, and plenty of those were popular.  We're all aware that not everyone who pirates would have bought the game, yes?  Even if all the piraters did buy the game, it may still have been commercially unsuccessful.  I keep hearing people blame piracy for this games failure, but if you're gonna do it, back it up with some numbers.

And yeah, the game industry is great for bland FPS's like CoD or Homefront. Oh, by the way, great music here huh? :)

Besides, the game industry is thriving.

snippet.textDisplay:
Generally I'm against pirating games unless the developer really can't make a profit off it anymore, but in bluelaguna18's case, he doesn't live in the USA, or, presumably, another country where Okamiden was localized, so even if he bought it online he wouldn't be supporting his own country's economy. On top of that, he doesn't have a DS to begin with, so pirating the game is, in his case, a moot point because he's not part of the audience anyway.

Just thought I'd throw in my two cents.
snippet.textOriginal:

On top of that, he doesn't have a DS to begin with, so pirating the game is, in his case, a moot point because he's not part of the audience anyway.

snippet.textDisplay:
@blulaguna18 It's about supporting the developer, which you are failing to do. A lot of work goes into making these games, and at the end of the day, it's a business. If the developer does not have the money to make another game or support it, then that's the end of it. We got lucky that Okamiden was even released after having so-so sales in the English speaking world. Your attitude is immensely selfish and part of a problem. 

You're stealing from Capcom and the chances of more Okami games.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh, the music is still intact, that's great news... well to me it's news, since I've gotten pretty behind on gaming, but I loved Okami, and from what I hear, this game was okay, but I guess I ought to make my own judgments. This music is promising though, that's for sure.
snippet.textOriginal: Oh, the music is still intact, that's great news... well to me it's news, since I've gotten pretty behind on gaming, but I loved Okami, and from what I hear, this game was okay, but I guess I ought to make my own judgments. This music is promising though, that's for sure.

snippet.textDisplay: I was waiting for you to upload this :D Love this track!

snippet.textDisplay: So many games, so little time. Okami is awesome so I really want to play this gane. I'm glad Rei Kondoh returned for the music, it has a really unique traditional japanese feel to it.
snippet.textOriginal: So many games, so little time. Okami is awesome so I really want to play this gane. I'm glad Rei Kondoh returned for the music, it has a really unique traditional japanese feel to it.
